content.right: Factors such as Active Agricultural Community, availability of School,distance from Kathmandu Valley and availability of Satellite Image were the key factors for chosing Bajrabarahi as the first VDC for mapping Agricultural and Food Security data.
The office building of Small farmers cooperative ltd was the place where training and mapping took place.
First day of training session. Five people from our team, including Dr.Nama Raj Budhathoki, went to Bajrabarahi and trained them so that they are able to map themselves.
Students writing answers to the questions. A questionare session as a part of research activity.
Locals collecting features they find interesting in field via. an app named OSMTracker
A discussion with the local citizens was organised to shorlist the agriculture and food security related features relevant to Bajrabarahi.
Late night discussions to figure out ways to collect agriculture and food security related information.
Local citizens enthusiastic about mappiing their VDC.
Majority of mapping is done by the local citizens. KLL team members were there if they needed any help.

One of the local agriculture entrepreneur enlightning KLL team about the agricultural product and the area. They mapped the area and tagged the information themselves and finally uploaded those information to openstreetmap.org.
One of the KLL team member teaching about mapping at one of the shops in Bajrabarahi.
Local farmer excited to share his locational information via. email. A glimpse of what we wereable to achieve.
